data.text:
Laurent Suprenant1

M, #298071

Last Edited=25 Jun 2008

Laurent Suprenant married Barbara Jane Bennett, daughter of Richard Bennett and Mabel Adrienne Morrison, in 1954.1

He was a writer at Canada .1

Citations

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

Joan Bennett1

F, #298072, b. 27 February 1910, d. 7 December 1990

Last Edited=2 Jul 2008

Joan Bennett, 1929 2

Joan Bennett was born on 27 February 1910 at Palisades, New York, U.S.A. .1 She was the daughter of Richard Bennett and Mabel Adrienne Morrison.1 She married, firstly, John Marion Fox, son of Robert Ralston Fox, on 15 September 1926 at Chelsea, London, England .1 She and John Marion Fox were divorced in 1928.1 She married, secondly, Gene Markey, son of Eugene Lawrence Markey and Alice White, on 12 March 1932 at Hollywood, California, U.S.A. .1 She and Gene Markey were divorced in 1937.1 She married, thirdly, Walter F. Wanger on 12 January 1940 at Phoenix, Arizona, U.S.A. .1 She and Walter F. Wanger were divorced in 1965.1 She married, fourthly, David Wilde on 14 February 1978.1 She died on 7 December 1990 at age 80 at Scarsdale, Westchester County, New York, U.S.A. .2

From 1926, her married name became Fox.1 She was an actress.1 From 1932, her married name became Markey.1 From 1940, her married name became Wanger.1 From 1978, her married name became Wilde.1

Child of Joan Bennett and John Marion Fox

Diana Wanger+1 b. 20 Feb 1928

Child of Joan Bennett and Gene Markey

Melinda Markey+1 b. 27 Feb 1934

Children of Joan Bennett and Walter F. Wanger

Stephanie Wanger+1 b. 26 Jun 1943

Shelley Antonia Wanger1 b. 4 Jul 1948

Citations

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

[S130] Wikipedia, online http;//www.wikipedia.org. Hereinafter cited as Wikipedia.

John Marion Fox1

M, #298073, b. circa 1900

Last Edited=30 Jun 2008

John Marion Fox was born circa 1900.2 He is the son of Robert Ralston Fox.3 He married Joan Bennett, daughter of Richard Bennett and Mabel Adrienne Morrison, on 15 September 1926 at Chelsea, London, England .1 He and Joan Bennett were divorced in 1928.1

Child of John Marion Fox and Joan Bennett

Diana Wanger+1 b. 20 Feb 1928

Citations

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

Gene Markey1

M, #298074, b. 11 December 1895, d. 1 May 1978

Last Edited=30 Jun 2008

Gene Markey was born on 11 December 1895 at Jacksonville, Michigan, U.S.A. .2 He was the son of Eugene Lawrence Markey and Alice White.2 He married, firstly, Joan Bennett, daughter of Richard Bennett and Mabel Adrienne Morrison, on 12 March 1932 at Hollywood, California, U.S.A. .1 He and Joan Bennett were divorced in 1937.1 He married, secondly, Hedy Lamarr on 4 March 1939 at Mexicali, Mexico .1 He and Hedy Lamarr were divorced in 1940.2 He married, thirdly, Myrna Loy on 2 January 1946 at San Pedro, California, U.S.A. .1 He and Myrna Loy were divorced in 1950.2 He married, fourthly, Lucille Parker in 1952.2 He died on 1 May 1978 at age 82 at Miami, Florida, U.S.A. .2

He was a writer.1 He was educated at Dartmouth College, Hanover, New Hampshire, U.S.A. .2 He gained the rank of Lieutenant in the U.S. Army.2 He fought in the Second World War.2 He was liaison officer to Louis Mountbatten in East Asia Command.2 He retired from the military, with the rank of Admiral, late of the U.S. Naval Reserve.2

Child of Gene Markey and Joan Bennett

Melinda Markey+1 b. 27 Feb 1934

Citations

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood, page 33.

Hedy Lamarr1

F, #298075

Last Edited=30 Jun 2008

Hedy Lamarr married Gene Markey, son of Eugene Lawrence Markey and Alice White, on 4 March 1939 at Mexicali, Mexico .1 She and Gene Markey were divorced in 1940.2

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

Myrna Loy1

F, #298076

Last Edited=30 Jun 2008

Myrna Loy married Gene Markey, son of Eugene Lawrence Markey and Alice White, on 2 January 1946 at San Pedro, California, U.S.A. .1 She and Gene Markey were divorced in 1950.2

She was an actress.2

Citations

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

Walter F. Wanger1

M, #298077, b. 11 July 1894, d. 17 November 1968

Last Edited=26 Dec 2012

Walter F. Wanger was born on 11 July 1894 at San Francisco, California, U.S.A. .2 He married, firstly, Justine Johnstone in 1919.3 He married, secondly, Joan Bennett, daughter of Richard Bennett and Mabel Adrienne Morrison, on 12 January 1940 at Phoenix, Arizona, U.S.A. .1 He and Joan Bennett were divorced in 1965.1 He died on 17 November 1968 at age 74 at Manhattan, New York City, New York, U.S.A. .3

He was educated at Dartmouth College, Hanover, New Hampshire, U.S.A. .3 He fought in the First World War.3 He gained the rank of officer in the U.S. Army Intelligence.3 He was on Woodrow Wilson's staff at the Paris Peace Conference in 1919.3 He was a film producer.3

Children of Walter F. Wanger and Joan Bennett

Stephanie Wanger+1 b. 26 Jun 1943

Shelley Antonia Wanger1 b. 4 Jul 1948

David Wilde1

M, #298078, b. 13 November 1917

Last Edited=30 Jun 2008

David Wilde was born on 13 November 1917 at New York City, New York, U.S.A. .2 He married Mary Jane Scott.2 He married Joan Bennett, daughter of Richard Bennett and Mabel Adrienne Morrison, on 14 February 1978.1

He was a news writer and film critic.1 He was educated at Yale University, New Haven, Connecticut, U.S.A. .2

Children of David Wilde and Mary Jane Scott

Amanda Dess Wilde2 b. 16 Mar 1952

Jennifer Jane Wilde2 b. 29 Jul 1954

Citations

[S171] Charles Kidd, Debrett Goes to Hollywood (New York, U.S.A.: St. Martin's Press, 1986), page 23. Hereinafter cited as Debrett Goes to Hollywood.

Diana Wanger1

F, #298079, b. 20 February 1928

Last Edited=30 Jun 2008

Diana Wanger was born on 20 February 1928.1 She is the daughter of John Marion Fox and Joan Bennett.1 She married, firstly, John Hardy Anderson, son of Harold Spurrier Anderson and Cynthia Hardy, on 8 May 1948 at Hollywood, California, U.S.A. .1 She and John Hardy Anderson were divorced in 1965.1 She married, secondly, Ivan Tors on 24 September 1974 at Nairobi, Kenya .1

She was given the name of Adrienne Ralston Fox at birth.2 In 1936 her name was legally changed to Diana Markey.3 In 1945 her name was legally changed to Diana Wanger.3 From 8 May 1948, her married name became Anderson.1 She was a painter.1 She and Oskar Werner were associated between 1965 and 1968.4 From 1974, her married name became Tors.1

Children of Diana Wanger and John Hardy Anderson

Amanda Joan Anderson5 b. 13 Mar 1949

Timothy Bennett Anderson5 b. 29 Apr 1952

Adrienne Lisa Anderson5 b. 11 Jun 1957

Cynthia Morrison Anderson5 b. 16 Nov 1964

Child of Diana Wanger and Oskar Werner

Felix Florian Werner4 b. 6 Jun 1966
